intro: Pedicularis megalantha, commonly known as the giant lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from red to orange. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its striking appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in conservation areas and botanical gardens.
